ovdesc.p: This file is used to record the details of the sweeps performed on the id Account for the year/month. Details such as the run date, sweep amounts, balance and references are stored both for processing and for use in reports or enquiries.

desc.p: This field is the specific date of the year/month on which the sweep was run and for which the associated data refers.
Specifies the cash pool id of the processing cash pool

A user sub-routine which is invoked to calculate the amount to be transferred between the id account and the linked account. A PGM.FILE record will be required before the sub-routine name can be input. It should be noted that the sub-routine is triggered only when the rule conditions, as defined in AC.CASH.POOL, have been met.

The id of this file is based on the Account number of the sweep and the year/month it was run. Format of the id is account.no-yearmonth for example a typical id would appear: 17205-200002 This records the sweeps performed on Account 17205 in February 2002.

This is the revised account balance after back value dated transaction based on which adjustment amount will be arrived. This balance reflects the revised starting balance plus/minus the already swept amount based on the sweep type. For this activity balance, once again the Cash pool conditions are applied to arrive the Adjustment amount which needs to be passed. Available only when the BACK.VAL.ADJ flag is set to YES and any adjustment is there for the already swept amount.

This field is used in conjunction with CASHFLOW type rules. These are essentially the same as a Two Way sweep rule except that there is a controlling limit on how much can be taken from higher level account. This limit and the AGREGATE.BAL field control how much can be taken from the higher level account. There is no limit on how much can be transferred to the higher level account
